name: Barb
mnemonic: This radical is shaped like a barb, like you'd see on barb wire, or something. Imagine one of these getting stuck in your arm, and think about how much it would hurt to pull it out with that hook on the end. Say out loud 'Oh dang... I got this barb stuck in me.'

name: Big
mnemonic: This radical looks just like a stick figure - more specifically, a really big dude stick figure. When you see this radical, just think big because this guy is really BIG!

name: Construction
mnemonic: You know those big steel girders that are used for the frame of big buildings? This is like the end of one of those - they have a very distinct shape, just like this radical. These girders are used in construction, which is why this radical means construction. Funny thing is, you use these girders to put together buildings just like you're going to use this radical to put together kanji!

name: Cross
mnemonic: This radical looks like a cross. Think about Jews carrying these crosses. Technically Jews don't carry crosses usually, but it will help you to think of this because of the kanji version of this coming up later.

name: Drop
mnemonic: This is a small radical, just a little dash. This little dash is a drop (of liquid, or something else). Remember, it's just a single drop, there will be other radicals that consist of multiple drops that mean other things, so it's important to remember this one properly (as just one drop!)

name: Enclosure
mnemonic: This radical encloses a lot of things (or at least tries to enclose things). It's like a big latchy box that goes around something and then chomps down to enclose it, making this the enclosure radical. Imagine something like this trying to come down from the sky to enclose you. Scary looking, right?

name: Enter
mnemonic: Be careful, this radical looks a lot like the 'person' radical (人). What's the difference? It has something extra sticking out the top, off to the side. When you look at this radical, though, I bet you can see how it looks like a tee-pee. The top is tied up and there's sticks overlapping each other up there. Then, the tent part comes down to the ground. This particular tee-pee, however, has a huge gaping entrance in it. So, what do you do? You enter it.

name: Fins
mnemonic: Human legs look like this radical (儿) because we have feet. Even animals have feet, too. But, this radical doesn't have any feet, just little things sticking out. That's why these are fish fins. They're sticking out the side of the fish (just imagine a fish in the middle of those fins, then have it flap them around). That's why this radical means 'fins' and not 'legs.'

name: Ground
mnemonic: This radical consists of a single, horizontal stroke. What's the biggest, single, horizontal stroke? That's the ground. Look at the ground, look at this radical, now look at the ground again. Kind of the same, right?

name: Gun
mnemonic: Doesn't this look a bit like a gun? You have a shoulder rest and the barrel. Bam bam bam! Another way to look at it would be to see it as a handgun, where the shoulder rest is the handle of the handgun and you're holding it that way. Either way, you should arrive at the same conclusion. This radical is a gun.

name: Leaf
mnemonic: There's a stem at the bottom and the leaf at the top, making this the leaf radical. It kind of looks like one of those giant pond leaves, don't you think?

name: Lid
mnemonic: This looks just like something you'd put on a kettle, right? Even a little handle to make sure you don't burn yourself. This radical is some kind of lid.

name: Mountain
mnemonic: This is a mountain - you'll have to add the lines that make up the roof of the mountain, though, if you want it more 'mountain-like.' Also something that might help: sometimes mountains have a couple of smaller peaks coming out the side of the main peak, too. Connect the dots and create the mountain in your mind.

name: Mouth
mnemonic: A big gaping square hole represents someone opening their giant mouth to tell you something stupid.

name: Nine
mnemonic: If you look at this radical in just the right way, you'll notice that it kind of looks like the letters 'n' and 'i' (the 'i' comes from the little flippy-up stroke on the right side). What do the letters 'n' and 'i' start spelling? Why, the word nine.

name: Person
mnemonic: If you were to draw a person with just strokes like you see in kanji, you'd create a stick figure, maybe something like this: 大. This, however, is just the legs... but why is it just the legs? This stick figure is a zombie stick figure. It comes at you, and you push it away, but when you do, the whole top half gets torn away. He looks up and says 'Hey, I'm a person too, you know. Why'd you have to do that?'

name: Power
mnemonic: Imagine a guy flexing his arm downward to show off his steroid-pumped arm. It's huge. It's so full of power. RARRRWWWRRR!!

name: River
mnemonic: This radical already looks like a river. See the banks of the river on the side and the flow of the river in the middle? There's even a slight turn in the river, too. So, when you see this radical, you should think 'river.'

name: Seven
mnemonic: What does this radical look like? Hmm, nothing much. What about if you turn it upside down? Now does it look like a 7 with a line through it? Close enough to help you to remember that this radical is seven, right? Just remember, when you see this radical, flip it over and see what number it looks like. If you can do that, you can remember the meaning of this radical!

name: Slide
mnemonic: When we say 'slide' we're talking about the kind you sit on and slide down. It's shaped just like one. Imagine a little version of yourself sliding down this slide and having a great time. Imagination + emotion makes for good memorization!

name: Stick
mnemonic: This is a single stick, standing upright. It even looks like a stick. The stick is standing up straight because it can stick out of the ground (radical), which is why it's vertical. So, when you see this stick sticking in the ground, just think 'stick.'

name: Sun
mnemonic: Since there are no circles in Japanese characters, sometimes rectangles or squares have to make do. In this case, this big rectangle is the sun. The middle line going through the center horizontally is the equator line. Imagine the sun as a big rectangle in the sky with a line through it and think about how weird that is - if you think it's weird enough in your mind, you'll probably remember this radical as well!

name: Toe
mnemonic: This radical looks just like the katakana ト (to) character, which sounds like the word toe. So, when you see ト think toe.

name: Tree
mnemonic: Do you see the tree in here? It has branches, and then it has the foliage coming down diagonally from it, spreading out like a tree would. That's why this radical is a tree.

name: Two
mnemonic: One line plus another line equals two lines. This radical represents the number two. Pretty simple, right? Can you guess what three looks like? I bet you can...

name: Woman
mnemonic: This radical looks like two stacked X's, one on top of the other. When it comes to chromosomes, males = xy and females = xx. therefore, this radical means woman.

name: Child
mnemonic: This radical is made up of two barbs and one ground radical. If there are barbs on the ground, who (especially) do you want to avoid that area? You want the child to avoid it, since children are so careless and often don't wear shoes. Imagine how bad you'd feel if you let a child walk around on top of these barbs! Pretty bad, I imagine.

name: Cow
mnemonic: There's a cross and a gun, with the gun going through the cross. You're using the cross to stabilize your gun, because you need to shoot a cow for dinner. The reason you bring your cross is because you need to bless the cow once you've killed it (and it's also a good stand for your gun). Poor cow.

name: Dog
mnemonic: Remember the 'big guy' that helped you to remember the 'big' radical? Now the big guy has something on his shoulder... what is that? You look, and see that he has a dog up there, perched as if it were a parrot or a cat or something. Dogs aren't supposed to be up on people's shoulders like that. How strange.

name: Doll
mnemonic: Doesn't this look like a doll? It has a head, arms, legs, and a body! So pretty.

name: Evening
mnemonic: Do you see the enclosure and drop radicals as a part of this radical? This enclosure is holding on to a drop because it's the evening. Evening air does a better job holding on to drops of liquid like this, which is why everything is covered in dew in the morning.

name: Eye
mnemonic: See the iris in the middle of the eyeball? Be sure to remember how in kanji there are no round things, so square things take their place. So, the rectangle shaped outline could be more rounded, and the middle more rounded as well. If it was like that, this radical would look an awful lot like an eye.

name: Fire
mnemonic: See the person radical here? It's got things coming off of it... what are those things OH MY GOD IT'S FIRE!!! Why is there fire on that person??

name: Five
mnemonic: If you use your imagination, this radical actually looks like the number '5.' You have to remove the vertical line in the bottom left, but once you do that, you have an easy way to memorize that this radical means five.

name: Flag
mnemonic: See the flag in this radical? There's a pole with a flag on the end of it, blowing in the wind. Basically, this radical looks just like a flag.

name: Grave
mnemonic: There's a cross in the ground, which makes this a grave. Now, later on you'll learn a really similar radical with a cross that's wider than the ground. Just remember, this is a regular ol' grave, where the cross is not as wide as the ground.

name: Hair
mnemonic: These three streaks flowing off to the side are three strands of hair. Pretty easy to see and remember, right?

name: Hand
mnemonic: This one's a little tough to picture, but I believe in you. The barb in the middle is the wrist/arm. Then, there are four regular fingers coming off of it and then one big thumb (the slide radical at the top). So, you have four fingers, a thumb, and a wrist. This is what makes up your crazy looking hand.

name: Head
mnemonic: This is the kind of head a child might draw - can you imagine it with eyes, nose, mouth, and ears, too? Whoever's head this is, it's really square and strange looking. All the better for you to remember this radical, though!

name: Heaven
mnemonic: There is a 'two' radical and a 'person' radical. The first level of a person's life is earth. The second level (this level, which is why there's a 'two' radical here) is heaven. So, when you see a person at level 2, you know they're in heaven.

name: King
mnemonic: This strange radical / symbol is not something anyone can have. Only a king can wear this crown upon his head. This radical is the sign of kings. Imagine your favorite king wearing this on their head. It's a pretty distinctive shape/pattern - I think you can do it.

name: Legs
mnemonic: This radical already looks like a pair of legs. There's even feet on these legs (unlike the fins radical, which you learned earlier). That's how you know these are legs and not fins (or something else).

name: Lion
mnemonic: This L-Shaped Radical is the radical lion, because 'L is for Lion.' You'll have to remember two steps for this one. You'll see that it's an 'L,' then you have to remember what 'L' stands for. I think 'Lion' is one of the first things that comes to mind, and it'll make for interesting mnemonics, which is why this radical is lion.

name: Middle
mnemonic: There's a stick going right through the middle of someone's mouth! Imagine that mouth being yours. Measure the placement of the stick. Perfectly aligned right in the middle. That's amazing, though to be honest, you probably have bigger problems than measuring the location of this stick in your mouth.

name: Moon
mnemonic: The moon is actually made of the sun, but it has streamers coming off of it leaning towards the left. Why? because the moon is always running away from the sun as fast as it can. It wouldn't want to get caught by the fire of the sun, after all!

name: Nail
mnemonic: See the barb radical with a head on it? It looks just like a nail. That barb on the end looks painful. Imagine getting that nailed into your arm, with someone hitting the head of this nail with a big hammer. Imagine how much it would hurt to pull out, too. No, really, imagine it - it will help you to remember this radical so much better. Thwack Thwack Thwack!

name: Narwhal
mnemonic: This radical looks like the katakana character 'na' (ナ) which we're going to say stands for narwhal. Plus, this radical kind of looks like a narwhal, right? The body and head on the bottom, and the single majestic narwhal horn coming out the top, shooting up out of the water and into the air. Don't confuse this radical with treasure. The sideways line for narwhal (ナ) is horizontal, the sideways line for treasure is at more of a downward angle (メ), like an 'X.'

name: Pile
mnemonic: This little triangle isn't quite a triangle because it's not one single thing. It's several things put together to form a little pile of something.

name: Real
mnemonic: With all the fake things in this world, it's sometimes nice to get something that comes out of the ground, like a tree. Things like this are real, not fake like plastic, etc.

name: Rice Paddy
mnemonic: Rice paddies are made up of fields with irrigation going between them. See the four rice paddies with water going between them and around them? That's why this radical is rice paddy.

name: Small
mnemonic: Inside this radical, you have fins and you have a barb. A fish that you can stick an entire barb through like this would have to be really small, since it's sticking through the whole fish body (which you can imagine by basing the body off the size of the fins compared to the already small barb.

name: Spring
mnemonic: Boing, boing, boing. This looks just like a giant spring that you might put on the bottom of your shoes to jump higher.

name: Stand
mnemonic: Two sticks are propping up the lid. By doing this, you are making it stand up.

name: Stone
mnemonic: There's a leaf growing out of a square thing (which is normally a mouth, but not this time). You should think this is odd, because the leaf is growing out of a stone, and leaves don't normally grow out of stones.

name: Stool
mnemonic: This looks just like a fold-out stool, amiright?

name: Stop
mnemonic: There's a giant toe and a stick in the ground in front of you. You're driving your car towards them, and don't see them until your lights hit them. What would these things cause you to do? Most likely stop your car right away.

name: Sword
mnemonic: If you look at this radical, it looks like the bottom part of a sword - the handle, more specifically. This radical also looks a lot like the power radical (力), so don't get confused. It's missing the little nubbin at the top, because 90% of the power comes from the sword to cut your enemies down (which is why the sword radical is 90% of the power radical).

name: Thousand
mnemonic: You're in a room, surrounded by slides. Out of the slides are tumbling cross after cross after cross. They're bouncing in and hitting you in the face, the arm, everywhere... Each cross has a number called out. 'ONE! TWO! THREE HUNDRED! FIVE HUNDRED!' and so on. You are worried it will never end, because you're starting to drown in the crosses. Then the voice yells out ONE THOUSAND and they stop. Still, you can't move. Think about all the numbers being called out, and keep wondering if it'll be the last one. Feel the relief you'd feel if it stops on a thousand, because you won't be buried anymore. The thousand crosses are covering you entirely, over your head, but because they're crosses you can still breath.

name: Treasure
mnemonic: This radical is treasure because 'X marks the spot' as they say. Don't confuse this radical with Narwhal (ナ). This one looks more like an X, which is where the treasure is.

name: Water
mnemonic: There's drops of liquid coming out of both sides of the barb. You can imagine this barb being stuck into the ground then pulled out. When it is, water comes gushing out on both sides of it!

name: White
mnemonic: You apply a small drop of magic liquid to the sun, and it causes it to turn white! This is a terrible thing, you realize, because in actuality, you just made the sun way, way hotter, melting everyone on earth. Maybe if you applied another drop it wouldn't be white hot anymore...?

name: Antennae
mnemonic: Doesn't this look like the antennae that would be on top of a house or maybe on top of a television? That's why this radical means 'antennae.'

name: Arrow
mnemonic: You have a slide coming down from heaven with this radical. You are using a slide to get out of heaven because you're escaping. As you try to escape, angels are shooting at you with arrows. You get hit by an arrow and it goes right through your arm. Grab your arm and think about how much these heaven arrows hurt!

name: Direction
mnemonic: This radical looks like a dude running off to the right. He's heading in a very distinct direction. Which direction was it again?

name: Door
mnemonic: Where does a flag usually go? It goes over a door. I know the 一 radical usually means ground, but in this case we're going to say the flag is in the doorway (where the 一 is the top of the door).

name: Drawer
mnemonic: See the drawer? It has two shelves in it with a little nubbin handle on each to let you pull them out. Imagine using this drawer - it'd be pretty oddly shaped.

name: Elephant
mnemonic: This radical is made up of two moon radicals stuck together. Two moons stuck together would be something huge - in this case, that huge thing is an elephant. In fact, if you look at the radical itself, it looks like the profile of an elephant, with its trunk on the right side and its legs in the middle and back!

name: Father
mnemonic: There's fins covering the treasure making up this radical. You pull away the fins and start digging where the X (because 'X' marks where the treasure is, right?). When you dig down, instead of finding treasure, you find your father. The shock of this in your imagination should help you to remember the meaning of this radical!

name: Fur
mnemonic: Do you remember the 'hair' radical? This is like that, except now the hair is attached to a tail. Animals don't usually have hair, though. Instead, they have fur.

name: Hat
mnemonic: Do you know those rice paddy hats? The ones shaped just like this radical? That's why this radical is a hat.

name: Heart
mnemonic: Take a good look at this one. It kind of looks like a heart (not the stereotypical Valentine’s Day heart, though). Think of a real heart. Basically, there’s a lump (the heart) in the middle, and three lines which make up the veins that go in and out of the heart to keep you alive. This kanji / radical does show up quite often, though, so it shouldn’t be too hard to learn as you go along, too. Remember, lump (heart) plus veins equals a heart… like, a real heart, not the fake pretty kind.

name: Life
mnemonic: This radical consists of a cow radical with the ground radical below it. If you have cows on solid ground, then you really do have a good life, I think. Sometimes this radical will show up without the slide part on the side too, though we'll treat them both as 'life.'

name: Mullet
mnemonic: It's a party in the back and business in the front. It's a mullet. You can see the short hair(s) on top, even, and the long, sweeping beauty in the back. This is the best haircut in the world. This is a mullet.

name: Nailbat
mnemonic: This barb has two things sticking through it. This looks like a devastating weapon. Why, it looks like a nailbat, actually!

name: Old
mnemonic: You have a cross on a mouth - who speaks the most about religion? Old people, mostly. Also, think the teachings of religion itself - also pretty old, age-wise. No matter how you look at it, everything about this radical is kind of 'old.'

name: Origin
mnemonic: You have 'two' and 'legs' making up this radical. Between two legs is where you came from, no matter how you look at it. These two legs are your origin.

name: Poop
mnemonic: You have the pile radical (ム), then you have something that's taller (this one). The taller pile is a little grosser. Why? Because it's a stinking pile of poop. We can only hope it's not human...

name: Ra
mnemonic: This radical looks just like the katakana character 'ra' (ラ). The sound 'ra' sounds just like the famous Egyptian God 'Ra' as well, so we're going to say this radical represents Egypt's God Ra.

name: Raptor Cage
mnemonic: This is no ordinary enclosure. It is an enclosure with an extra reinforcement (see it sticking out the bottom right of the enclosure radical?). Why is this enclosure reinforced? Because it's the raptor cage. I wonder how long they'll be able to hold the raptors... It didn't work out all that well on Jurassic Park...

name: Spoon
mnemonic: This radical looks like a child, sitting up, with no head, reaching its arm out for you. It wants only one thing, a spoon so it can eat its pudding, which it just dumps down its neck. Try to take the spoon away from the decapitated child... unfortunately you can't, because it's too strong (zombification has already taken effect!)

name: Triceratops
mnemonic: The three horns represent the triceratops, one of the most awesome dinosaurs ever.

name: Winter
mnemonic: This looks like a stool radical, but something is wrong. If you sat on this stool, you might slip right off because of that slanted bit. Why is the stool so slippery? Because it's covered in ice because it is currently winter.

name: Alligator
mnemonic: See the mouth and teeth of this alligator, which is facing to the right? You wouldn't want to get your hand stuck in there, that's for sure.

name: Bamboo
mnemonic: See how tall the stalks are with little bushy things at the top? It kind of looks like bamboo if you use your imagination a bit.

name: Bed
mnemonic: You'll have to complete the line on the right side in your mind, but see the rectangle bed and the pillows? This is totally a 'bed.'

name: Beggar
mnemonic: Doesn't this look like someone on their knees, holding their hands out (clasped) and begging for something (money, their life, etc.)? That's why this radical is known as the beggar.

name: Car
mnemonic: Doesn't this look like a top-down view of the frame of a car? There's the rods that make up the base of the car and things for the wheels to go on. That's why this radical is the car radical.

name: Ceremony
mnemonic: This radical looks like a guy standing on one foot (because you only see one leg) holding onto something that produces drops of liquid. This person is pretty drunk, apparently. It's because he's performing the ceremony of drinking lots and lots.

name: Clam, shell
mnemonic: There's a giant eye on top of some fins. Imagine this giant eye to be on top of a clam. It has little fins on which it runs around on, escaping from your every attempt to capture it.

name: Cliff
mnemonic: See the cliff? It's facing towards the west. What ocean is to your west? That's the direction this cliff is facing.

name: Ear
mnemonic: A bit more elaborate than the eye, though similar. In fact, if you go blind, your ears become one of your new senses of sight, which is why this is like another, somewhat modified, eye. You'll even notice little lines sticking out of the eye, that's because ears stick out more than eyes (目), which is why this radical is the ear radical.

name: Energy
mnemonic: This radical is shaped kind of like a dam. See the wall and the water pushing over the top? If this radical is a dam, then it must create a ton of energy as well!

name: Flowers
mnemonic: See the little things sticking out of the ground? Those little things are pretty little flowers. You know they're flowers and not, say, grass, because they're pretty spaced out. You'll learn grass later, and it will be less spaced out, but somewhat similar to this, so keep that in mind!

name: Foot
mnemonic: Do you see the dude doing a flying dragon kick (or something) to the right? What does he hit the target with? Obviously it's his foot.

name: Forehead
mnemonic: Sure, this forehead is a bit square, but that's because it's Frankenstein's Monster's forehead. Also, did you notice that this is just the top part of the head (冂) radical? This is just the forehead part of that!

name: Frog
mnemonic: Do you remember / know of the game 'Frogger'? Looking from a bird's eye view, this radical looks just like a frog, running across the highway.

name: Generation
mnemonic: If you look at this radical, you'll notice that the inner piece built onto the ground radical and the outer piece, also built onto the ground are kind of the same... except, the outer piece isn't completely finished yet. The middle bit is all done, and they're the center. The second layer currently being formed is the next generation. Surely, there will be even another generation going around the second layer (when it's done) and another and another later on.

name: Helmet
mnemonic: The helmet is almost like the lid (亠) except it has the little side things to hold it onto something. That's why this is a helmet that goes onto things you need to protect.

name: Horns
mnemonic: Can you see the horns? You could put these horns on anything. Donkeys, people, monkeys, and so on. That's exactly what we'll be doing when we learn kanji that have horns too.

name: Insect
mnemonic: This radical contains a mouth and a pile. You basically have a pile of mouths sitting there... what do you think they're covered by? They're covered by insects. Make sure to imagine all these insects walking all over and eating / laying eggs in the pile of mouths (yuck).

name: Leader
mnemonic: This radical technically means 'person' (like 人), but we're going to shift the meaning a little bit. It's actually a little like the person radical, but it's taller and skinnier standing above the rest of those peons. That's why this is a leader, not a regular old person.

name: Loiter
mnemonic: The leader (ｲ) has a little extra on top of him, holding him down, holding him back. It's causing him to wait... it's causing him to loiter.

name: Master
mnemonic: This is no ordinary king. He also happens to be a master at balancing a drop of water on his head without it soaking in or beading off. He's the master of water drops... the water king! You’ll have to imagine a King dressed like a master (master may mean different things depending on who you are… I tend to imagine someone who’s like an old Buddhist monk, but that’s just me). He’s balancing a single drop of water on top of his head, and it isn’t breaking (think sphere). He is totally the master… even better than a king.

name: Measurement
mnemonic: You have a drop radical and a sort of deformed cross radical. When the cross gets wet, it gets all bent out of shape (like in this radical) so it won't fit in the cross holder. You have to make a new one, so the first thing you need to do is get a new measurement of it.

name: Not
mnemonic: If you see this radical in a kanji, you'll want to think of the opposite of whatever other radicals there are. It looks a lot like the below, but guess what? It's not the below radical.

name: Pelican
mnemonic: This radical kind of looks like a pelican standing there with it's giant pelican mouth open. It even has the long legs, too.

name: Pi
mnemonic: Obviously this looks just like the good ol' 3.14 something-something all people are supposed to learn about. It's the math symbol that has to do with circles... pi!

name: Plate
mnemonic: This is a plate (the bottom part of the radical) with three tall columns of Jello on top. When you carry the plate, be sure to keep it flat, because the Jello Towers need to be perfectly straight otherwise they'll fall off and spill all over. Even though there's Jello on top, you should still remember this radical as plate, because that's the most important part.

name: Red
mnemonic: You have some legs (altered radical) and fins below a grave. Imagine yourself looking at all these severed limbs... there's blood everywhere. No matter where you look around this grave, it's totally red.

name: Rice
mnemonic: Not to be confused with a rice paddy (田). This is just raw rice, like the grain that grows out of the ground when rice is raw and fresh. When rice is particularly ripe, it'll kind of look like this at the top of the stalks. That's why this radical is 'rice.'

name: Samurai
mnemonic: The samurai looks a lot like the grave radical. The difference is the top horizontal line. For samurai, the top horizontal line is longer because they're higher class. therefore their gravestone crosses are longer than regular graves, making this radical the samurai radical.

name: See
mnemonic: There's an eyeball on top of some legs. When your eyes get taken places (on legs, in this case), your eyes are seeing those things. That's why this radical means 'see.'

name: Spikes
mnemonic: On the ground there are a bunch of spikes coming out. You wouldn't want to step on those now, would you?

name: Thread
mnemonic: There's a small pile of poop (see the radicals small and poop in there?). You have to go through it and break it apart to look for some thread your dog/cat ate. Imagine yourself breaking it apart, looking for this thread. It smells bad, and it's making you gag. Use this feeling of disgust to help you remember this radical... to help you to remember you're looking for some thread in the poop to make sure it passed (and you don't have to do any surgery on your pet!).

name: Two Face
mnemonic: You have a head, and a line going right through the middle. Who else has a line going through the middle of their face? None other than the Batman villain Two Face.

name: Umbrella
mnemonic: Do you know how the bottom of an umbrella is shaped? It has a hook that curls around for the handle. So, when you see this radical, you should think of the bottom of an umbrella, which will help you to remember that this radical means umbrella.

name: Axe
mnemonic: This is a strange looking axe, I know. But think of it this way... the letter 'T' is in the cliff. What is the 'T'? Of course it has to be 'Mr. T,' who's super awesome. Think of Mr. T wielding a terrifying axe, running after you screaming 'I pity the foo'' at you while trying to chop you down. That makes for a pretty terrifying axe.

name: Blue
mnemonic: You have life on top of the moon (ignore that life is missing its little slide on the left side). What would life on the moon look like? Well, first of all, they have no air, so they probably look pretty blue from asphyxiation. When you meet them, it turns out you're right. They're a civilization of blue people. Imagine them all living up there, being all blue and Smurfy (or just blue).

name: Coffin
mnemonic: See the grave with the slide going into it? What do you slide into graves? You would slide a coffin into a grave.

name: Color
mnemonic: There's an enclosure at the top of your bed. As you lay in bed, you reach up into it, and knock a ton of colors on your face. That's your paint enclosure, turns out. Go look at your face in the mirror, it's covered in the color black, green, red, and so on. What a terrible way to wake up.

name: Feathers
mnemonic: This radical already looks like a set of wings, right? What are on wings? Well, usually lots of feathers.

name: Go
mnemonic: You have the radical for loiter and a two radical and barb radical (i.e. two barbs). Someone who uses two barbs on you while you're loitering really wants you to GO!!

name: Gold
mnemonic: There's two sets of spikes underneath that hat. It's actually a trap, to prevent anyone from coming in and stealing your gold. Why else would you make a trap? Everyone likes to protect their gold.

name: Ice
mnemonic: Remember the radical for 'drop' (of liquid)? This is two drops instead of one. When you see two drops, you should think 'the next stage of water.' What is the next stage? Why, that is ice.

name: Key
mnemonic: This is a very oddly shaped key but it's a key nonetheless.

name: Kick
mnemonic: First of all, these legs have spikes on them (scary!). Now, what would be even worse? If these spiked legs wanted to kick you.

name: Lantern
mnemonic: Think of an old-style lantern. It's on top of a few legs (you can only see two from this angle) and it's in a box shaped holder at the top. You can imagine these lining the streets before electricity, right? That's why this radical is a lantern.

name: Lip Ring
mnemonic: There's a nail going into a mouth. Rather than a nail, though, it's a lip ring

name: Meat
mnemonic: Inside your head you can only think about people, people, and more people. This is bad, because really all you want is their meat, because you're some kind of sick cannibal... you monster. When you think of 'people' in your head, you're really just thinking about more meat you can eat.

name: Meet
mnemonic: You have two piles of hats. They look lonely, all separate like that. You think... hmm, I wonder if I could set something up? Make these two lonely hat piles less lonely, you know what I mean? So, you set up a date, and set them up to meet each other. Of course, focus on the 'meet' part of this mnemonic. How will you get them to meet? What will happen when they meet? So on and so forth.

name: Mustache
mnemonic: See the mustache going around the mouth? I wish I could grow a sweet mustache like this.

name: Rain
mnemonic: Two Face (巾) is covered with drops of liquid. There's so many drops. This must be rain.

name: Run
mnemonic: See the guy running? Don't confuse this with foot (足), though. The head is just a streak because this person is running so fast.

name: Say
mnemonic: One. One. One. One. One. Mouth. The mouth will say one thing at a time. It's doing what mouths do best, just saying things one after another. That's why this radical is 'say.'

name: Self
mnemonic: That little fleck / drop on your eye is what makes you unique. It's what makes you your self. It's you, you know?

name: Sunflower
mnemonic: See the big flower at the top of the stem and ground? It's the biggest flower of them all, a bright and beautiful sunflower.

name: Tsunami
mnemonic: You've seen one drop (丶), but what happens when you triple this and have three drops, which happens to be the maximum number of drops you can have? You end up with a devastating tsunami, because there's too much water and nowhere for it to go. Just think of this as a lot of water. When you have a lot of water, you have a tsunami.

name: Twenty
mnemonic: You have 十 plus 十... what do you get when you add these two kanji together? You get twenty.

name: Viking
mnemonic: This is a helmet (宀) except there's extra spikes / horns on it. Who wore helmets with horns on them, at least according to television? The vikings did.

name: Water Slide
mnemonic: You have a drop of water at the top, and then a squiggly looking thing that looks like it could be a slide. That's why this radical is the water slide. What fun!

name: West
mnemonic: You have pi coming out of a mouth. '3.14,' it says. We must take the secret of the circle with us, away from here. We must go to a magical place where nobody will prosecute us for our math... a place to the West!.

name: Window
mnemonic: See the criss-cross in the pseudo-square shape? That's the frames of a big window you can look out of. It's not perfectly shaped like a rice field - it's more artistic, that's why this is a window and 田 is not.

name: Wolverine
mnemonic: You know Wolverine from the X-Men? He has three claws that come out of his hand whenever he needs to fight, not at all unlike the radical you see here.

name: Angel
mnemonic: First of all, there's a cross making up the middle, which auto-makes this one a religion-based radical. That cross is the frame of someone's body, and the things coming off are wings. This is an angel.

name: Animal
mnemonic: This looks like a tail with some hairs coming off of it. It shouldn't be confused with a nailbat, though, because it's curved, and the things sticking out are more erratic, like hair or fur would be. That's why this radical is the animal radical.

name: Bad
mnemonic: The evening radical is under the ground. Things that happen underground at night are usually all bad things. Think of all the bad underground stuff that happens at night. Gambling, prostitution, drug dealing... you name it. It's all bad.

name: Blood
mnemonic: There's a little speck of something on your plate (皿). 'What is that?' you ask. Oh no... that speck is BLOOD!!! Your waiter's getting fired for sure.

name: Box
mnemonic: This box is open. There could be any number of things inside, but for now all you need to know is the meaning of this radical, which is box.

name: Chopsticks
mnemonic: There's two chopsticks grabbing on to some rice. Of course, the person using them isn't all that skilled, but we'll forgive them, for now...

name: Cyclops
mnemonic: There's a head with a little bit of hair on the top. There's also one big eye in the middle. Only one creature has a head like this, and that creature is the cyclops.

name: Death
mnemonic: There's a lid on top and a lion. There's two ways to look at this. You can be stuck inside something with a lion in it (and a lid on top so you can't come out)... if this happens, surely you will meet your death. Another way to remember this radical is to think 'what's the only way to get a lion in a pot (with a lid)?' ... the only way is if the lion has already met his death.

name: Eat
mnemonic: Under a roof you kick something white. That white thing you kicked was a big white goose. Since you killed it with the kick, you get to cook it up and eat it.

name: Fish Tail
mnemonic: You know what fins are - double that and you have a fish tail.

name: Fortune
mnemonic: Someone has a toe in their mouth. They are a fortune teller telling your fortune, and in order to tell your future, she has to take one of your toes and taste it. She must be a really good fortune teller if you just let her do this.

name: Jet
mnemonic: This is like one of those jets that have the little nose-wings going on too. Imagine you're looking at the jet from the top down, this is what it would look like (and why this is called 'jet').

name: Lack
mnemonic: You have an enclosure around a person. Why have you captured this person? Because you lack the humans you need for your experimentation... sicko.

name: Long
mnemonic: You have a modified key radical on top of the kick radical. You kick the key as far as you can then measure the distance. How long did it travel?

name: Mama
mnemonic: This radical is just like the katakana character 'ma' (マ). So, let's keep things simple and make the radical mama.

name: Neck
mnemonic: This radical looks like an alien with a big body (the eye radical, technically), with weird neck going up to a pair of little eyes on a head (the horns and leaf radicals. The thing you should focus on is the thing connecting the two - that would be the neck.

name: Pine
mnemonic: This radical is a tree with something extra on the top. Although it's sort of arbitrary, we're going to associate this kind of tree with a pine tree, making this radical a pine.

name: Ribs
mnemonic: Not only does this radical look like the hiragana/katakana character リ (which is the first two letters of the word 'ribs'), but this radical also kind of looks like ribs itself, though you'll have to turn them sideways in your mind, first.

name: Sheep
mnemonic: Kind of like a sheep when you look at it from above. See the two horns of the ram sheep, and the body of the sheep going back (with all its wool sticking out to the side) and then the tail in the back. It's a sheep! How cute.

name: Bird
mnemonic: See the cool wing on the bottom? See the head with the neat feather coming out of the top? This is a bird. Tweet tweet!

name: Black
mnemonic: A sunflower with a fish tail... this strange fish-flower hybrid wasn't even the right color, it was completely black... even blacker than black itself, if you can believe it.

name: Cobra
mnemonic: This looks a lot like the snake you will learn later on, but it's different because this snake is standing up, ready to strike. Can you think of a snake that takes up this position? How about a cobra?

name: Duck
mnemonic: If you look at this radical the right way, you can see a duck head, facing to the right. What a majestic duck this is, too.

name: Fish
mnemonic: You'll want to ignore the other radicals that make up this radical (except the fish tail radical) and just look at the shape. It's like you're looking at a flatfish, laying on its side. The tail is there at the bottom, the body is the middle, and the little enclosure part is its little fish head. That's why this is a fish.

name: Gate
mnemonic: This radical already looks like a gate, right? Just imagine a big gate with two pillars, one on either side. Then, up above are the doors, which can come down at any moment.

name: Ghost
mnemonic: See the head radical whisping off to the left side? Also, do you see the mouth, and the strange face? It's moaning and floating around. Only one thing does this, and it is a ghost.

name: Husband
mnemonic: You have the radicals ground and big to make up this radical. There's a big guy on the ground... who is that big guy? Embarrassingly, it's your husband. Feel the shame that he got knocked down by a little girl, which is why he's on the ground.

name: Pig
mnemonic: You have 'animal' in this radical already, that should be a clue. So what kind of animal is it? The animal in and under the ground, but really it's not underground, it's just covered in mud which makes it look like it's underground. Also, there are toes laying around with it, because this animal will eat anything (good way to get rid of bodies are pig farms... I hear). So, what's this animal that's so covered in mud that it's like it's underground and eats toes because it will eat anything? It's a pig.

name: Sail
mnemonic: This looks like some billowing sails being puffed up by the wind, which is why this radical is 'sail.'

name: Soldier
mnemonic: This radical is a dude standing up straight, swinging his arms with his march, and carrying a sword (which hangs off to the left). That's why this is the soldier radical.

name: Stamp
mnemonic: This radical looks a little like the letter 'P' right? It's a 'P' printed onto something... or, maybe it's not printed, it's a stamp that's been put on the paper. Peter Parker likes to use stamps instead of pens.

name: Table
mnemonic: What happens when you put a flat surface on top of a pair of legs? You get a table.

name: Wing
mnemonic: See the wing? It's kind of like a bat wing, or something like that. Either way, it's just a wing.

name: Yellow
mnemonic: The flowers coming out of the ground in the rice paddy looked just like fish fins. The even stranger thing, though, is that they made everything around them completely yellow. Be sure to imagine the surrounding area as so incredibly yellow it hurts your eyes.

name: Boobs
mnemonic: This radical consists of two piles. Whether you're a dude or a gal, you probably have two piles on your chest. That's why these are boobs.

name: Cage
mnemonic: This radical is a cage because it's covered on all sides but one (the one open side is where the cage door or gate is). There's nothing inside this cage because there's no gate, and whatever was inside has gotten out. I hope it wasn't rabid...

name: Cloak
mnemonic: The cloak goes over everything. It protects it and keeps hidden whatever is below it. This looks like a cloak too, right? The right side is the cape part, coming down, and the top part is the part you tie around your neck.

name: Compare
mnemonic: This radical is made up of two slightly different versions of the spoon radical (which you should already know). Each spoon radical is kind of different, though, so you have to look at them carefully and compare them to find said differences.

name: Gravity
mnemonic: The sun has a wing on it. That wing symbolizes the sun spinning around, pulling the planets in. That's the gravity of the sun, so remember this radical as 'gravity'.

name: Hills
mnemonic: See the rolling hills with the road going off into the background to another hill? That's why this radical is called 'hills.'

name: Hole
mnemonic: You have a helmet on top of a volcano. What is the helmet covering on the top of the volcano? Why, it's definitely covering the hole at the top. Imagine it bubbling and trying to push the helmet off so it can shoot lava and ash out of its hole.

name: Hook
mnemonic: There's a flat line for where the hand was cut off. In it is a hook like a pirate might have. Yarrrr.

name: Horse
mnemonic: Don't confuse this radical with bird. It looks similar with the wing on the bottom and the shape on top, but it doesn't have a feather sticking out of the top of its head. So while it moves fast like it has wings, it's no bird, it's a horse.

name: Ikea
mnemonic: This radical has both table and stool in it, shrunken down into a small space. Who else does that (and also has tables and stools?)? It would have to be the incredible furniture company Ikea!

name: Sauron
mnemonic: This is a sideways eye. Who's big eye is this? It's Sauron's eye. He's looking for those hobbits he is.

name: Sickle
mnemonic: Most of this radical is just the rice radical, but the top part is something coming to cut the rice from its stalk. That, my friend, is the sickle.

name: Snake
mnemonic: There's two ways to remember this one. First, you could look at this and see it's a coiled up snake. Or, if you want, you can imagine it as a snake head, with its face facing to the right (see it's open mouth?). We may use either when learning a kanji, but for now you can pick the one that fits best with your memorization style. Just make sure you get to snake when you see this radical.

name: Suit
mnemonic: You find a hat on the ground with a weird mouth as the design on the front. You think it looks weird, but when you put it on, you find it suits you quite well. Imagine yourself feeling not so sure about this hat at first. But, once you put it on, you feel pleasantly surprised.

name: Tongue
mnemonic: Imagine a wall with a thousand mouths on it. Every space is filled with mouths, all writhing around and doing gross things. Then, as if signaled, they all stick their tongues out at the same time, trying to lick you. You try to back up, but there’s another wall of a thousand mouths, all sticking their tongues out too.

name: Waiter
mnemonic: The waiter is walking towards you with a dish in his hand (you see it in his outstretched arm?). That's how you know he's a waiter, he's bringing you your food.

name: Brush
mnemonic: It's easier to imagine if you turn your head sideways. The left side of this radical is the brush. See all the bristles?

name: Butcher
mnemonic: This radical looks like the letter 'B' - what does 'B' stand for? In this case, it stands for butcher.

name: Cleat
mnemonic: There's the bottom of the shoe and the spikes coming out of it. Only one kind of shoe is like this, and that is a cleat.

name: Clown
mnemonic: Clowns do weird tricks. One trick they might do is stand on their mouth (or, stand on someone else's mouth). Imagine a clown doing either one of these things to remember this radical: clown.

name: Devil
mnemonic: You've probably seen how the identical kanji 反 means anti. I want you to have a better radical for that, though, since it comes up a lot. When you think of the word 'anti' what do you think of? How about the Anti-Christ? Who does he work for? That's the devil.

name: Heavy
mnemonic: This radical is made up of a thousand sunflowers. If you tried to lift them, what would it be? Well, quite heavy, for one.

name: History
mnemonic: A mouth that's talking about treasure... That sounds more like history to me. Don't go searching for it.

name: Hut
mnemonic: See the roof on top of this little building? It's like a little hut you might see next to a beach, or something!

name: Pope
mnemonic: Someone has crosses for eyes. That would have to be someone really religious in Catholicism. Who's number one over there? That would be the Pope.

name: Spicy
mnemonic: You're standing up on top of a cross. Why? Because you ate something so spicy that it caused you to beg Jesus for mercy. You need to save your mouth from the spicy flames. To make sure he hears you, you stand up on the closest cross. Make sure to feel how spicy this is in your mouth to remember it better!

name: Tent
mnemonic: Kind of a strange tent, I'll admit, but one that will protect you from things trying to get in (that's why it has all the spikes). It's the best you can do considering you're in a cloth building.

name: Train
mnemonic: This radical looks like a railway track going off into the distance. What rides on railway tracks? That would be a train.

name: Alcohol
mnemonic: See the West radical on top of the mouth radical? Think of someone's mouth who is from the wild west (like in a cowboy movie). What is always in their mouth? It's alcohol.

name: Beans
mnemonic: This radical has a pod (the square in the middle) between the ground and some roots. That pod is going to turn into a plant someday. What plant will it be? Great big beans, like the ones from Jack and the Beanstalk.

name: Chinese
mnemonic: Why is your husband putting flowers in his mouth? It's because he's Chinese. It's just something they do over there, you explain. Imagine that you have a husband if you don't, and imagine him actually doing this.

name: Dynamite
mnemonic: Doesn't this radical look like one of those old fashioned dynamite things that gets pushed to set the fuse? That's why we're calling this radical 'dynamite.'

name: Ent
mnemonic: There is a tree with a mouth on it. In terms of trees with mouths, I think Tree Ents make the most sense. They're the big tree people from the Lord Of The Rings trilogy. Go watch those movies / read those books and come back if you need to know more.

name: Fault
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji 失 and shares the meaning too: fault.

name: Geoduck
mnemonic: This radical consists of a clam with a leaf on it. Because that's so general and not all that useful ('leaf clam' won't cut it), we're going to make this radical geoduck as it's a very distinct clam-like creature. If you don't know what a geoduck is, look it up. It's quite bizarre. It's also (for our sake) a clam with a leaf on its head. Perhaps it's embarrassed of what it is, so it's trying to hide itself?

name: Kiss
mnemonic: When you combine winter and mouth, you get winter mouth. What is the 'Winter Mouth,' then? For this radical, it's going to be a kiss. Imagine someone coming in with a mouth covered in ice, trying to kiss you. This is what the Winter Mouth does. Let it kiss you - it's extremely cold!

name: Music
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji 曲, which you learned earlier, making this radical music.

name: Sick
mnemonic: There's a mullet radical with ice running down the back. This person is so cold that they're creating ice out of their mullet. They are obviously very sick. Be sure to image them with a pus-covered face while they sneeze and try to brush the ice away. Try to imagine the sickest person you can.

name: Stairs
mnemonic: See the stairs shape on the right side? Also note it's being held up by a pillar or beam or something, to make sure the stairs don't just collapse as you walk up them.

name: Superman
mnemonic: Who's strong enough to kick someone inside of a cliff then under the ground? the only person I can think of that strong is superman.

name: Tombstone
mnemonic: What are stool graves? They're tombstones. Just imagine yourself sitting on one like it's a stool.

name: Turkey
mnemonic: This looks kind of like the top of the bird radical, but not quite. It's kind of a dumb looking bird radical top. What's a dumb bird, so dumb that it would look into the sky to drown itself with its mouth open? A turkey.

name: Bear
mnemonic: This looks like the letter 'B,' which stands for bear. B for Bear!

name: Blackjack
mnemonic: You have the radical twenty and the kanji one. Put those together and you get 21. What's another name for 21? That's blackjack.

name: Boob
mnemonic: Before you had two piles. Now you only have one. One pile is singular, that's why this pile is just a single boob. Also, it has a little nipple on there, making it more boob-like, whether it's a dude-boob or a lady-boob, that's up to your own imagination.

name: Drunkard
mnemonic: This is a ceremony radical with a slide radical. Remember how the guy at the ceremony has been drinking? Well, now he's really drunk (a drunkard) and walking like he's sliding down a slide, no control over his body.

name: Escalator
mnemonic: Do you remember stairs? This radical is a lot like that, but it has extra bits and pieces. It's still stairs... but it's more complicated. That's why it's an escalator instead!

name: Few
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned previously (少). The meaning is the same too: few.

name: Good
mnemonic: You wouldn't think so, but kicking the sun is a really good thing. If you don't kick it every once in a while, it won't come up. So, don't forget that it's good to kick the sun, okay?

name: Older Brother
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, 兄. The meanings are the same too, older brother.

name: Orders
mnemonic: The 'Hat-Ground' stamp is on this envelope. That can only mean one thing: Orders from HQ. Imagine this stamp on some orders for you - read the orders out loud to help yourself remember that this hat-ground stamp means 'orders' and nothing else.

name: Say Humbly
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, 申. They have the same meanings too. This radical means say humbly.

name: Skin
mnemonic: The skin radical is the same as the skin kanji you learned in lesson four, but here's a little story in case you forgot.

name: Sound
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji you learned before, 音. It has the same meaning, too: sound.

name: Temple
mnemonic: This radical looks kind of like a temple on a hill maybe, no? With all the layers, n' stuff? Just picture that first horizontal line as the base of the ornate temple balancing on that hill underneath it and you'll have no problem remembering this radical.

name: Witch Doctor
mnemonic: Doesn't this radical look like a witch doctor standing there with a mask and feathers / other things in his hair?

name: Beforehand
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Beforehand.

name: Big Bird
mnemonic: This looks like something that's really big taking huge steps. It also looks like it has a beak. What's big and has a beak? The famous character Big Bird.

name: Crab
mnemonic: This looks a bit like the clam radical (貝) but it's spikier and crazier looking. What's another shelled creature that's more out there than a clam? That would be a crab.

name: Early
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji 早, which you learned earlier. We'll use the same meaning as well: early.

name: Excuse
mnemonic: This radical consists of some legs carrying off the sun in an enclosure. Those legs are yours. When the police stop you, though, what's your excuse? Come up with one and say it out loud, starting with 'My excuse is...'

name: Injustice
mnemonic: No matter which way you look, there's spikes everywhere. You're being punished for something you didn't do, and that punishment is to be put in a room covered in spikes. You have suffered quite the injustice.

name: Jackhammer
mnemonic: Do you see the handles on the top and the barb on the bottom? It's a jackhammer. How can you tell? The two diagonal lines on the side show the motion of the jackhammer going up and down really fast, doing what jackhammers do. BBBHHRZHHHHRHHRZHZHHZH JUJUJUJUJU.

name: Someone
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji 者, which you learned earlier. We'll use the same meaning, as well: someone

name: Tie Fighter
mnemonic: This radical looks just like a tie fighter as seen from above / below / the front. Vrroozooomm!

name: Tofu
mnemonic: See the 'T' and 'F' that makes up this radical? Those letters stand for tofu, our favorite fermented bean blocks.

name: Younger Brother
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji 弟, which you learned earlier. We'll use the same meaning as well: younger brother.

name: Books
mnemonic: If you put a bunch of books into a shelf, they'd kind of look like this, no?

name: Central
mnemonic: This radical looks just like the kanji central. So, we're going to name this radical central as well.

name: Circle
mnemonic: This radical looks just like the kanji you've learned already (丸). It also has the same meaning: circle.

name: Correct
mnemonic: This radical looks just like the kanji 正, so it has the same meaning, too: correct

name: Creeper
mnemonic: Do you see the little mustache on top of the mouth? It's one of those creepy mustaches... sort of a John Waters sort of deal. That's why this radical is called creeper.

name: Diamond
mnemonic: Something small and white is inside a cliff. Technically they're clear, but when I think of small white things in cliffs or mountains I think of diamonds. That's why this radical is diamond.

name: East
mnemonic: Looks just like the kanji you learned before, 東. It also means the same thing: East.

name: Fish Stick
mnemonic: This stick has fins on it. Why? Because it's a fish stick.

name: Fruit
mnemonic: Everything's about rice in Japan and ancient China. So, the rice paddy that is on the tree isn't rice, of course, it's another kind of food, it's fruit.

name: Hundred
mnemonic: This radical looks just like the kanji hundred which is why we're going to call this radical hundred as well.

name: Idea
mnemonic: This radical looks just like the kanji you learned earlier (意) and has therefore has the same meaning as well: idea.

name: Products
mnemonic: Three boxes are stacked up on top of each other. These are products waiting to be shipped out.

name: Roof
mnemonic: This radical looks just like a roof, does it not?

name: Shrimp
mnemonic: Kind of a stretch, but this radical has a little head and a couple shrimpy legs on it, which is why we're calling this one the shrimp.

name: Somebody
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji somebody. That's why we're calling this radical somebody as well.

name: Womb
mnemonic: This radical is made up of a slightly modified 'previous' kanji and a 'grave' radical. What is your 'previous grave'? Hint: It's the place you were dead in before you were alive. That's your mother's womb, at least until your parents gave you life. That's why this was your previous grave... your womb!

name: Bar
mnemonic: There are two drunkards here. That makes this radical a bar.

name: Now
mnemonic: You know this radical because you know the kanji that looks exactly the same. The kanji is now and the radical is also now.

name: Part
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned earlier: part.

name: Pool
mnemonic: See the enclosure with the drop (of liquid) inside? What kinds of things to you fill with drops of water? Imagine this is a swimming pool.

name: Public
mnemonic: You know this radical because you know the kanji that looks exactly the same. The kanji is public and so the radical is also public.

name: Well
mnemonic: Think of this radical like a map you're looking down on. There are four streets going through this small town. Right in the middle is the most important thing - the well. Everyone goes through the four streets to get to the well and get the water they crave.

name: Cemetery
mnemonic: Here is a grave pile. Where do grave piles (usually) exist? In a cemetery.

name: Grass
mnemonic: Don't confuse this with flowers. Grass is closer together, and a little bushier, like this. It's also more random and squished down in parts. If you see a bush of lines like this, it's probably going to be grass.

name: Height
mnemonic: This looks like a doll radical, but it's falling apart. Because it's falling apart, it's losing its height and becoming shorter.

name: Man
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji man making it man as well.

name: Paragraph
mnemonic: When you enclose the things that come out of your mouth, you're putting them on a piece of paper and you're also enclosing those words in paragraphs as well.

name: Saw
mnemonic: You're constructing a table. On the table is a drop of blood, which is your blood. This is from cutting yourself on the saw that you're using to make the table. Imagine yourself cutting yourself with the saw by accident. Ouch!

name: Walk
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji it looks like: walk.

name: Glue
mnemonic: This kanji is the same as the kanji attach. Because the word 'attach' is so terrible when it comes to creating mnemonics, let's change it to mean glue. After all, glue attaches one thing to another thing, so I think it's pretty appropriate.

name: Robot
mnemonic: This radical looks like a robot head. It has an antennae on top, plus a strange face which is made up of several sensors all in a row. That's why we're calling this one 'robot.'

name: Squid
mnemonic: See the squid shape here? There's its head, its body, and its tentacles (two, anyways). Pretty squid-like if you ask me!

name: Valley
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji you learned earlier: valley

name: Zombie
mnemonic: This radical has a figure reaching out both hands at you with a grave on his head. This is a zombie, and he must have just recently dug himself out of the grave by the looks of it (why else would he have a grave on his head?).

name: Conflict
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji 争, which you learned earlier. It also means conflict.

name: Gambler
mnemonic: The gambler holds a cross as he plays blackjack. He stands on his two legs expectantly, hoping he hits the big one. He just put all his money down. If he doesn't win this one the gambler loses everything, including the two legs he's standing on.

name: Happiness
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji happiness. Don't get confused with the radical 'spicy' which is very similar.

name: Long Ago
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji it comes from. It means long ago.

name: Mask
mnemonic: This looks kind of like a mask, right? It has horns, it has crazy eyes, and it has a big mouth with big lips. Nobody would actually look like this, which is why this is just a mask.

name: Noon
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, making it noon.

name: Previous
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji it comes from. It means previous.

name: Treasure Chest
mnemonic: There's a treasure radical inside this box. What holds treasures? Treasure chests.

name: Become
mnemonic: This is just like the kanji 成 and has the same meaning too: become. It will be used in a surprising amount of more complicated kanji.

name: Black Hole
mnemonic: When you shoot your gun at the sun, it becomes winter. The shot you fired sent the sun into a crazy chain reaction, making it implode on itself and become a black hole. Imagine this happening, and imagine the shock you'd feel. You shot the sun. You caused this infinite winter (and soon black hole death) to happen.

name: City
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji and also means city!

name: Ego
mnemonic: There's a drunkard holding onto a nailbat. He's holding this nailbat because he's going to go bust up the dude who busted up his ego. He wouldn't do something like this for ego's sake when he's not drunk, but this is a drunkard, after all.

name: Flasher
mnemonic: When a creeper is inside of a cloak, what are they? They're a flasher, because you know they're going to reveal to the world what's under that cloak in a public space.

name: Genius
mnemonic: Like the kanji 才, this radical means genius as well, though it wouldn't take one to know that, right?

name: Reason
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned, which also means reason.

name: Together
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, together.

name: Arrows
mnemonic: There are three arrows pointing to the left. Instead of one arrow (like with the radical and kanji 矢), these are three arrows... aka plural, more than one! Arrows!

name: Boob Grave
mnemonic: You have a boob and a grave. So, naturally this is a boob grave. Just imagine a single boob being buried, getting a service, and having people crying all around.

name: Explosion
mnemonic: See the energy bursting outward? That's an explosion. Boom!

name: Fly
mnemonic: This radical is pretty complicated, but not much looks like this radical, so you're in luck. This looks like a giant flying fortress of some kind. See the propellers on the back as it moves to the left? Just imagine something like this flying through the air. That's why this radical is fly, because it is flying.

name: Mona Lisa
mnemonic: This radical looks like a combination of a brush radical and the beauty kanji (美). So, what's something beautiful you can paint with a brush? The most famous is probably the Mona Lisa.

name: Righteousness
mnemonic: The horns of the king. They are so large and they cause the king to have an ego. This ego gives the king a sense of righteousness that he shouldn't have. Well, I suppose that's what kings do, but those horns are ridiculous.

name: Angle
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji it comes from, making it angle.

name: Half
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji that also means half, so you should know it at least half way.

name: Mohawk
mnemonic: You have something old on your head that's standing up. What is this thing? An awesome mohawk.You've had it so long it is looking pretty old... but still awesome.

name: Next
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji 'next' so the radical is also next.

name: Number
mnemonic: The kanji is 'number in a series,' but that's too long for a radical. We're going to call the radical form number.

name: Peace
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji 'peace' making this radical peace.

name: Stilts
mnemonic: See the guy on top walking on those two long sticks? Those sticks are stilts.

name: Ability
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji meaning it comes from. This is ability.

name: Bathtub
mnemonic: See the dude sitting inside the box? His head is sticking out the top. That's a bathtub he's sitting in.

name: Cheap
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji, cheap, making this radical cheap as well.

name: Football
mnemonic: Your friend is on the ground, and you step on him with your cleat. There is no friendship here. This is a true sport you're playing. This is football (I don't care if you think of it as soccer football or American football, they should both be fine).

name: Outhouse
mnemonic: This is an outhouse. There's a lid over the poop to keep the stink out, but for some reason you're dangling your legs into the outhouse hole. You'll have to come up with a reason why, but just try to imagine this and gross yourself out - it will help you to remember.

name: Slinky
mnemonic: Not only is it one spring, it is twenty springs. Combine these springs together to form a mega spring, an amazing slinky.

name: Clothes
mnemonic: You kick a lid off a box. Inside the box is a bunch of clothes. This radical will be the same as the kanji you'll learn later on, so it's helpful to learn it as clothes even though it doesn't quite look like clothes.

name: Corn
mnemonic: It has a leaf and it's connected to something that has lots of little sections. This looks just like a short, stubby thing of corn.

name: Demon
mnemonic: This is a demon. Can you see him? He has a crazy face and some tentacles holding something demonic. Try to figure out how to see a demon.

name: Four
mnemonic: This radical looks just like a number four. It's just the version of four that isn't connected at the top.

name: Leather
mnemonic: When I look at this radical, I see the body and (mainly) head of a bull. What are bulls made of? They're made of leather.

name: Nailgun
mnemonic: You have a lid covering your face, from your forehead to your mouth. There's a nail sticking in it. The reason you have this lid up protecting you like this is because someone's trying to use a nailgun to shoot you in the face.

name: Road
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It is road.

name: Accept
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Accept.

name: Control
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means control.

name: Cow God
mnemonic: The five is a bit altered, but you can see it. So, you have five mouths. And you have an abnormal cow (㐄). In this case, you have a five mouthed cow. This is the cow god.

name: Death Star
mnemonic: The roof of the moon is what protects the moon. But, the moon is just a bunch of ribs now, because it is still being built. Wait, who builds a moon and what moon is built? I can only think of one moon-like thing that gets built, and that is the Death Star.

name: Guest
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means guest.

name: Nature
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Nature.

name: Sunrise
mnemonic: The sun is coming up out of the ground, making this radical sunrise. Of course, don't confuse this with sunset! You can do that by thinking that the sun is an optimistic and bright thing, so it tends to come up, not go down (at least whenever possible).

name: Both
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Both.

name: Capital
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Capital.

name: Circus
mnemonic: You put your life (twice, one for each show) into an elephant's hands (or trunk). Where do you work? At the circus. Don't get this confused with the similar 黄, though. That one is different, and doesn't involve life or elephants.

name: Friend
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Friend.

name: Greenhouse
mnemonic: The flowers grow big from the sun. In order to let them grow big even when it's not sunny, we put them in the greenhouse.

name: Mix
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Mix.

name: Wedding
mnemonic: This radical looks like someone wearing a giant dress who has a tear in their eye. This is a woman at her wedding. That explains the big dress and the tear (of happiness!) in hear eye.

name: Announce
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Announce.

name: Egg
mnemonic: The letter 'E' is for 'egg' - easy enough, right?

name: Ten Thousand
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Ten Thousand.

name: Change
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Change.

name: Comb
mnemonic: Look at all those little things sticking out. You could easily use it to comb your hair.

name: Exit
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned way way back. Exit this information out of your head and remember it so you know this radical as well.

name: Farming
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Farming.

name: Peoples
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Peoples.

name: Rake
mnemonic: If you look at it, you can see it's a weird looking rake.

name: Substitute
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Substitute.

name: Surplus
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Surplus.

name: Giant
mnemonic: If you were to look at a giant from above, this is what you would see. Do you see the head and two arms? The giant is facing towards the right.

name: Hercules
mnemonic: The life thread is cut with a sword by the Moirai. They are, in Greek mythology, the ones who decide when to let you die, by cutting your life thread. This is probably most well known in the story of Hercules, so we'll go with that with this radical.

name: Lovely
mnemonic: I don't know what this thing is, but it's lovely. It has two eyes, a funny mouth, and a scraggly beard. It's lovely, and nothing else, okay? So, remember it that way.

name: Specialty
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Specialty.

name: Thorn
mnemonic: This radical looks like a (crazy) hand with something sticking right through it. What do you usually get stuck in your finger? That little thing is a thorn.

name: Above
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji, above.

name: Blame
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Blame.

name: District
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means District.

name: Morning
mnemonic: This is the left side of the kanji 朝, so we'll call it morning, too.

name: Nose
mnemonic: If you look at this radical right, you'll see a NOSE (with a squinty eye on the left).

name: Odd
mnemonic: This is just like the kanji you learned in the previous level, odd. It's odd to have a big lip ring.

name: Ox
mnemonic: What has big horns but a small sun? Let's say it's an ox, because there's Babe the giant blue ox, and oxes are pretty big anyways. And, if an ox is big enough, it makes the sun look small in comparison, especially if you're Babe the giant blue ox (though you only have to remember 'ox').

name: Servant
mnemonic: It's like you're looking at someone from above. Their head is in the middle and their arms are to the side... but they're chained. Why? Because this is your servant.

name: Joker
mnemonic: Taking a sword to a mouth... sounds like something the Joker from Batman would do. He likes to carve smiles into people's faces, which is why this radical means 'Joker.'

name: Lineage
mnemonic: A thread goes through the ground. It traces your lineage. You follow the thread all the way back to many generations, to find out your lineage involves Ghengish Khan. Feel the thread and the dirt in your hand and actually trace the lineage.

name: North
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means North.

name: Oversee
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Oversee.

name: Turtle Shell
mnemonic: Poor turtles. We don't like them here. This is a turtle shell. See the shell with just a tail remaining? It's the only thing we didn't remove off the turtle. It's just a shell with a tail, so basically it's just a turtle shell.

name: Bookshelf
mnemonic: There's a door on the books. The door is part of a bookshelf, which holds the books together.

name: Chester
mnemonic: He's a creeper and he's 'Four-t' (forty). He's known as Chester the molester. Don't cross paths with this sicko.

name: Fang
mnemonic: This is one of those radicals where we'll take the actual meaning. Imagine this in your mouth. It's one tooth that sticks out more than any other. It's your fang.

name: Line Up
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Line Up.

name: Potato
mnemonic: See the potato at the top? Then, like a potato underground it has roots going out of it (to create the next potato, I'm guessing). That's why this radical is potato.

name: Request
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned previously: request.

name: Rocket
mnemonic: This is a very complicated and tall radical. It has a lid on top to keep the explosiveness in. It also contains a treasure, at least for the people who will receive what's inside this. Also, it has a cow, which will be used for milk on Mars. This is a rocket filled with goodies for space people.

name: Cat Pirate
mnemonic: See the 'CP' in this radical? It stands for Cat Pirate. Meoaarrrr.

name: Certain
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Certain.

name: Night
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Night.

name: Same
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Same.

name: Inside
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Inside.

name: Interval
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji. It means Interval.

name: Shark
mnemonic: This looks like it is water, but it's barbed and sharp. It also has a fish tail. What is in the water, has 'barbs' and has a fish tail? Something that will bite you, that's for sure. Let's call this radical shark.

name: Sock
mnemonic: Best way to put a lid on the mouth of a child is to put a sock in that child's mouth. Shuts them up good, it does. A nice fat sock and they can't talk anymore, essentially putting a lid on their mouth.

name: Storehouse
mnemonic: Your flowers become your servants. You plant them, you water them, you bring them up, then you cut them down and put them in your storehouse. They do what you want because they become YOUR servant, not the other way around. That's why you can tell them to sit in the storehouse where they wait until you come to eat them.

name: Catapult
mnemonic: See the rock in the catapult? It even has little legs to hold it steady so it can catapult better.

name: Claw
mnemonic: This looks like a claw of some kind already, making it quite easy!

name: Member
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, member.

name: Slice
mnemonic: See the guy? See how he was CUT IN HALF??? That must have been one heckuva slice to do that to a person.

name: Belt
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji 'belt,' which makes this belt as well.

name: Sake
mnemonic: This radical looks like a big weird caterpillar bug thing. But, for the sake of everyone's sanity, we'll just call it sake, okay?

name: Shuriken
mnemonic: See the shuriken stuck into the ground? In case you don't know, a shuriken is just a throwing star. What awesome ninjas use. That's what's in this radical.

name: Turtle
mnemonic: There's a turtle shell inside this turtle radical. You can tell because there's a whole head and tail on this thing, making it a real turtle, not just a turtle shell.

name: Bright
mnemonic: This looks just like the kanji you learned before, bright.

name: Departure
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, departure

name: Right
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, Right

name: South
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, South

name: Sweet
mnemonic: This radical is the sun with its hair sticking out. Why is the sun's hair sticking out like this? It ate wayyy too many sweet things causing it to have too much energy making its hair stand on end.

name: Valuable
mnemonic: This looks like the kanji you learned before, which is valuable.

name: Omen
mnemonic: There's an explosion around your legs. It was just as the fortune teller warned. This is the omen she was talking about. Think about what happens after the omen hits. What horrible fortune teller magic will happen??? (This radical is the same as the kanji, which you haven't learned, which is why it's an omen).

name: Prize
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, Prize

name: Skewer
mnemonic: There's a stick going through some juicy meat. This is a skewer.

name: Violence
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned earlier, Violence

name: Have
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Have.

name: Prefecture
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Prefecture.

name: Propaganda
mnemonic: A national flag in your mouth was promised to taste sweet but it is actually spicy. You've been lied to. These lies are propaganda.

name: Sky
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Sky.

name: Think
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji think.

name: Tooth
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Tooth.

name: Buddy
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Buddy.

name: Former
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Former.

name: Hill
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Hill.

name: Reality
