mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji, reality.

name: Scroll
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji you learned a while back: 巻. They both mean scroll.

name: Six
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Six.

name: Three
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Three.

name: Employ
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Employ.

name: Every
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Every.

name: Preserve
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Preserve.

name: Cactus
mnemonic: See the cactus coming out of the ground? It's happy to see you!

name: Signpost
mnemonic: It's a post with signs saying 'Chicago →' and such on it, making this a signpost.

name: Trident
mnemonic: The trident goes up, sticking through a fish (or whatever). AQUAAMANNNN!

name: Wide
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Wide.

name: Bone
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Bone.

name: Grenade
mnemonic: This is the shell of a grenade that has blown up. BOOM! It exploded, splitting it down the middle.

name: Melon
mnemonic: I'm not totally sure why this is a melon, but it is. Just think of the outside as the melon shell, and the inside 'pile' radical as a pile of seeds inside the melon, making this a melon.

name: Shop
mnemonic: Since we already have a 'roof' radical, we're going to use the second meaning of this kanji and make this radical shop. As in, a place that you buy things at. A shop.

name: Badger
mnemonic: You know the animal radical. This is just like that with a little extra. So, you know it's an animal already, which means all you have to do is remember what kind of animal. In this case, it's a badger.

name: Business
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Business.

name: Imperial
mnemonic: Stand on the moon so you can look down on your countries. The thing with all the lines nad borders are the borders of all the countries you rule, for you are imperial.

name: Pirate
mnemonic: This kind of looks like big (大) which I think you'll remember you learned by pretending this was a big guy. This big guy, however, has a funny leg... a peg leg. That makes him a pirate. We'll see another radical later on that's like this and has a parrot on his shoulder (even though that one is more pirate-like, that one is going to be parrot).

name: Redwood
mnemonic: This is a tree with two extra branches on top. It's the tallest of the tree-like radicals, which is why we're making this one the redwood, because redwoods are super tall and big and live a long time.

name: Blade
mnemonic: You have a sword that has a drop of something on it. That drop is a drop of blood. Sure, a sword will cut someone to spill some blood, but all you really need is any kind of blade to cut someone, sword, knife, whatever.

name: Can
mnemonic: It's kind of hard to see, but if you look at this the right way it looks like a tin can. The lines in the middle show the circumference, and the lines on the tops and sides show the outline of the can.

name: Dragon
mnemonic: A standing turlte is less like a turtle and more like a monster. What kind of monster? A dragon! Rawwwr.

name: Wind
mnemonic: This radical is the same as the kanji you learned a long time ago. It should be familiar, like the wind itself.

name: Wrap
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Wrap.

name: Again
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Again.

name: House
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji House.

name: Protect
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Protect.

name: Fat
mnemonic: The meaning of the radical is the same as the kanji 太, fat.

name: Favor
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Favor.

name: Task
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Task.

name: Wave
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Wave.

name: Form
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji form.

name: Mysterious
mnemonic: What's under this lid that smells like poop? I don't know! How mysterious.

name: Sunlight
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Sunlight.

name: Crab Trap
mnemonic: This radical looks like a small anima (匹) has a crab (其) sticking out of it. Often when a crab is eating a small animal, that small animal was put inside a crab trap to catch the crab, luring it in with the small animal. That's why this radical is crab trap.

name: Tights
mnemonic: There's a creeper that has his head through his legs. The 'T' signifies what the creeper is wearing on his legs, which is tights. These tights are too tight, in fact, and it's getting creepy.

name: Times
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Times.

name: Name
mnemonic: This is the same as the kanji Name.

name: Psychopath
mnemonic: Inside this guy's forehead you have a spoon and a bunch of hair, something that's sliced into 4 pices in a box (𠚍) in the upper left. That's the mind of a psychopath right there.

name: Splinter
mnemonic: Although a little bit modified, there is a turtle shell that's on a mustache with this radical. The only thing with a mustache that hangs around turtles is Splinter the giant rat from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. So, this radical is Splinter (the giant rat).
